text: this is stephen farrell for the new york
times in brooklyn we're surveying areas
of the neighborhood for damage caused by
Hurricane sandy Prospect Park was one of
those areas hit trees have fallen down
workers said that one jogger had
actually been injured by a tree and that
they're closing off the park because of
that work crews were out today early
cutting down trees cutting branches off
them and making the park safer it's
unclear when it'll be properly open
again although some people were around
looking taking photographs and assessing
for themselves the extent of the damage
I live over on eighth street and we
routinely walk here every morning so
we're sad to see all of this devastation
i can assume that it's much much worse
in other areas of the park
